answers.answer: Ed:HSP, or Henoch-Schonlein Purpura, is a condition in whivh the small-caliber blood vessels of the skin become inflamed.  Cause is unknown.  Involvement of internal blood vessels must be looked into, as well.The first thing you need os for your physician to determine with certainty that you have HSP or something else.  HSP itself 9is self-limiting and annoying rather than serious, and treatment )(oral cortisone etc.) is available, but precise diagnosis is paramount.  You may have to wait a bit until the tests make your situation plain.Best.  Dr. R

question: One day (Tuesday)I woke up with about 13 little itchy bumps on my right side of my trunk.  They weren't very large, but by the next day they had accumulated to over 50 on one side and about 20 on the ohter, and also spreading some to my arm.  That day I went to the doctor, and they said they weren't sure what it was, and put me on lotrimin (didn't help).  That night they combined and soon my entire trunk was red with a darker red inside.  It was extremely itchy and I went back in to the hospital.  He said he never seen something like that and put me on medidrol and some anti histamines.  Neither of which worked to stop it from spreading or itching.  By the weekend my entire trunk was extremely red, but my stomach was okay, and it stopped before getting to my back.  Also my feet were a redish purple, and it was on my knees, and calves and in the inside of my elbows.  There were no blistering, or cracking, and when you touched it the color stayed the same.  Finally a doctor said I had a condition called HSP.  I will be going to a specialist this week so he can take a sample of my skin and send it to Mayo.  I was just wondering what this really is, and how does one get something like this.
